page.title: 13Bridport Carnival.
page.content: The Bridport carnival was revived in 1971. Apart from a carnival in 1947 in aid of the Bishop's Appeal Fund there had not been a carnival Procession in the town since the early 1930s. Bridport's carnival is held once a year usually on the third Saturday of August. Floats are divided into three classes: 1. Public Houses of Bridport; 2. Firms from Bridport and the surrounding area; 3. Individual floats. The floats assemble at about 5.30p.m. in Sea Road and set off at about 7.00p.m. The parade takes about an hour to go round the course. Many people walk the course in costume collecting money for local charities.
